subject: Communication
title: Triggers: Your Emotional Buttons
description: Learn Triggers: Your Emotional Buttons in one minute.

hook.text: Someone cuts you off in traffic and you're enraged for an hour. Someone else shrugs. Same event.

buildup.text: Emotional triggers are situations that activate disproportionate emotional responses rooted in past experiences.

discovery.text: Triggers aren't about the present moment. They activate old emotional memories stored in the brain's limbic system.

twist.text: Knowing your triggers is the first step to disarming them. If you predict your reaction, you can choose a better response.

climax.text: Self-aware people map their triggers: specific words, tones, situations, or people that consistently activate strong.

punchline.text: You can't choose your triggers. You can choose what you do next.

quiz.question: Where do emotional triggers originate?
options: Past experiences stored in the limbic system
